title: What's 'What's a Computer, Though' Though?
description: It's ​been ​roughly two years since graduating from Penn State's Schreyer Honors College and joining IBM as a full-time software engineer.
text:
its ​been ​roughly two years since graduating from penn state's schreyer honors college and joining ibm as a full-time software engineer. ​ ​during ​this ​time, ​i've ​had the chance to explore my field at very high-level, understand bit better who i am an engineer, person.
first foremost, heart belongs mathematics.  ever early days of education, was fascinated by beauty, elegance, philosophy behind now feel incomplete any time not learning or actively working on something that is rooted in mathematics.
next, ​i ​love engineering, blessed have opportunity make living writing software.  unique ability connect people across world, community built around major part what drew me into it profession.  growing learn importance thankless, active participation broader community, building eminence one's personal brand process.
believe not, platform which this blog written (hax cms) free, open source, community-driven moreover, thanklessly maintained former professor mine; has mastered art through thankless contribution community.  his contributions played role success first few ibm.
i able hit ground running cloud-native engineering job thanks coverage containerization & container orchestration our courses.  these emerging technologies are enough their lifecycle traditional cs education does cover them.  meanwhile they lie core modern development industry.​  thus, wanted publish blogs hax return him, feed he managed cultivate over many while also own process.
looking forward, plan write mainly about technical work do free time.  particular, lately i've been reading lot analysis use place where can reflect share some interesting things process.  developed projects past (with more planned for future) write here.
i so hopes exploring contributing communities topics love.  no schedule, plan, just jumping experiment see comes it.

title: What's Real Analysis, Though?
description: During my time at Penn State, I hesitated to fully commit to a mathematics degree.  By the time I did finally commit to pursuing a math degree, I only had enough time

title: What's Completeness, Though?
description: One way to characterize the real numbers is to simply take an axiomatic approach. ​ ​That is to say that we will first boil their nature down to a single property
text:
one way to characterize the real numbers \mathbb{r}  




 is simply take an axiomatic approach. ​ ​that say that we will first boil their nature down a single property or statement from which can derive rest of essential properties. then assume this true without proof, and proceed build theoretical results atop property.
to be clear, not sufficient construction since are asserting some fundamental justification.  but a pragmatic eventually toward more pure construction.  if show all required properties follow particular property, purify our construction, just need follows underlying logical foundation.
whats axiom completeness, though?
here i describe completeness
what's ​the ​nested ​interval ​i ​will ​describe ​property
what's ​a sequence, ​sequences
what's ​bolzano-​weierstrass theorem, ​bolzano-weierstrass theorem
what's cauchy criterion, ​cauchy criterion
what's ​foundation numbers, ​explain ​how ​aoc, nip, bw, cc interconnected logically

title: What's Soil Science, Though?
description: Nearly a year ago, I came across a book selling for $3 at a small-town thrift store which caught my eye.  The book is called Urban Farming by Thomas J. Fox.
text:
nearly a year ago, i came across book selling for $3 at small-town thrift store which caught my eye.  the is called urban farming by thomas j. fox.  it covers topic of urban agriculture both birds eye view, thinking very abstractly and globally about current problems can be partially mitigated agriculture, from more narrow perspective do-it-yourself gardener.
among various topics find intriguing surrounding gardening one in particular stood out to me - soil science.  lies core itself any functional society.  could argued that we must first engineer crop production before really anything else.  hence, has long history being engineered human needs.
what's more, science underlying engineering rooted complex biochemistry microecology.  provides home millions species microorganisms often form symbiotic relationships with plants.  these involve performing some chemical process plant exchange portion plant's resources.
soil particularly interesting part because aforementioned processes have not been reproduced scalable way engineering.  is, outside selectively breeding plants responsible ​executing those on our behalf.  this perspective, potential serve as catalyst breakthroughs seen clearly.
in ​this ​series ​of ​blogs, ​i ​would like document findings make continue read into engineering.

title: What's FootballSim, Though?
description: Pet projects: as engineers we can all relate to the experience of having way too many of them, and the experience of having that one pet project
text:
pet projects: as engineers we can all relate to the experience of having way too many them, and that one project about which are particularly passionate.  for me, my highest regarded is develop a football simulator capable simulating brothers imaginary leagues.  in fact, this led me pursue software career path.
as i've grown engineer through career, learned value properly scoping projects.  also personal projects especially vulnerable improper scoping.  partially due our passion connection them - strive perfection out result they never fully come fruition.
with iteration game, i'd like impose very well-defined scope keep myself accountable, goals realistic.  first approach problem from level slowly drill down into finer-grained details i progress.
scope
for iteration, will implement model randomly generate final score game (sometimes called "box score") given each team's offensive defensive skill levels.  additionally,
the should be good fit against real data, meaning there
 some initial data science involved before any development 
occurs.once implemented, itself supporting utilities 
should packaged library atop cli api later 
implemented.a âsingle-page web ui developed interacts with api.the build & deployment full stack simple, repeatable, semi-automated both local production deployments.
in series blogs walk progress on pillar project's science, development, ci/cd, everything in-between.  once completed, assess determine how plan next new blog series.

title: Football Box Score Web Scraper
description: The first step of producing software capable of randomly generating a real-world phenomenon (such as football scores) is simple: get the real-world data.
text:
the first step of producing software capable randomly generating a real-world phenomenon (such as football scores) is simple: get data.  in this blog, i will reflect on web scraper developed to acquire data which was ultimately used produce my footballsim box score generator model.
data ​retrieval
the ​first ​step ​of statistical modeling against is, well, having so would need start journey by identifying source, and writing some automation retrieve structure its for me.
in ​my ​case, ​im looking scores, delight quickly discovered database near perfect source me.  it contains entire super bowl era even scores dating well before era.  only real challenge overcome leveraging fact that does not expose any sort rest api retrieving instead write scraping from html.
what's scraping, though?
web ​scraping form automated retrieval involves parsing content (typically html format) reformatting into more structured format storage analysis.  large scale systems, take place after crawling.  crawler traverse websites store raw, unprocessed content, later be processed stored scraper.
openai's language models, such gpt-3 4 powering their chatgpt software, were trained gathered scraped using crawlers scrapers.  since then, significant effort has been made limit crawling across various websites.  such, your experience may forgiving mine was.
the ​football ​database ​web ​scraper
i rust-based cli database's html, storing json files locally.
for iteration, really needed implement one command - fbdb-webscrape boxscores.
retrieve historic database

usage: fbdb-webscrape[.exe] boxscores [options]

options:
  -o, --output [output_format] output
 -f, --file [output_file] file to
 -y, --year [year] year [default: 2024]
 -h, --help print help
this allows user input year, an output format, file, parse database. ​ ​i ​used ​it ​to ​produce like below (but with many scores!):
[
 {
 "date": "1/2/03",
 "away-team": "team a",
 "away-score": 28,
 "home-team": b",
 "home-score": 31
 },
 "1/3/03",
 c",
 13,
 d",
 6
 }
]
in future, plan circle back add new commands can scrape next iterations project.  at time ​project ​consists ​three rust files:
main.rs: main function runs execution cli. also helper functions requesting reqwest boxscore instance. cli.rs: definition. project clap_derive, extension clap crate collection structs enums equipped proper trait implementations derive macros.boxscore.rs: struct implementation. serde serde_json enable easily serialized deserialized format.
from perspective make use are stars show.  fundamental aspects these given code samples below.  firstly, instantiated client fetch webpage:
/// response string
fn get_html_string() -> string // initialize blocking client
 let = reqwest::blocking::client::new();
 
 query webserver response
 wrapped future result
 res client.get("https://example.com/")
 .header(user_agent, "mozilla/5.0 (windows nt 10.0; win64; x64) applewebkit/537.36 (khtml, gecko) chrome/88.0.4324.150 safari/537.36")
 .send();
 text return it
 res_str res.unwrap().text().unwrap();
 res_str;
}
then, html.  particularly useful way css selectors (which provided via selector struct), shown below.
/// all paragraph elements example.com
fn parse_box_scores(res_html: &string) vec<string> mutable vector strings append mut paragraph_strings: vec::new();

 html
 document html::parse_document(res_html);

 select elements
 paragraph_selector selector::parse("p").unwrap();
 paragraphs document.select(&paragraph_selector);

 each element, append
 paragraph_string: paragraph.text();
 paragraph_strings.push(paragraph_string);
 }

 strings
 paragraph_strings
}

i could have implemented bit properly.  forward, refactor the functions fetching struct, then "from" struct.
this being project, hurdles faced working around 403 error codes when server.  turns out, servers typically block requests unless request header identifies agent load content.  case, user-agent mimicking browser content.
beyond ​the ​aspect spent lot fiddling clap_derive.  this partially because documentation limited, discussion online refers core module.  types clap_derive differ those clap, leading occasional confusing "method found" errors.
despite few challenges along way, able finish implementation about day's worth programming, consider success.  information usage found readme file.
next ​steps
now we our data, better understand it.  conduct what called exploratory analysis, summarizing visualizing ways attempt identify trends modeled.  discussed detail blog post series, model.
